content.html: When it comes to id attribute values I’m still living in an HTML 4.01 world apparently. Ooops! 😅 Glad to see the restrictions got lifted. #TIL
content.text:
When it comes to id attribute values I’m still living in an HTML 4.01 world apparently. Ooops! 😅

Glad to see the restrictions got lifted. #TIL

content.html: Correction: back in the HTML 4.01 days "#" was not a valid [id] value. With HTML5 it is. See mathiasbynens.be/notes/html5-id… for details. #TIL
content.text: Correction: back in the HTML 4.01 days "#" was not a valid [id] value. With HTML5 it is. See mathiasbynens.be/notes/html5-id… for details. #TIL

content.html: Wasn't it that historically valid ids had to start with a-z, but that got changed or rather adapted to reality later on in the spec, now allowing any character?
content.text: Wasn't it that historically valid ids had to start with a-z, but that got changed or rather adapted to reality later on in the spec, now allowing any character?

content.html: What makes you say `id="#"` is invalid? (Should I go and update mathiasbynens.be/notes/html5-id… after 12 years? :P)
content.text: What makes you say `id="#"` is invalid? (Should I go and update mathiasbynens.be/notes/html5-id… after 12 years? :P)

content.html: I think that had a backslash in its selector? 🤔 /cc @bramus
content.text: I think that had a backslash in its selector? 🤔 /cc @bramus

content.html: There’s a new proposal for animating shared-elements across web pages. But what happens if we apply it to individual elements within a page? @TerribleMia explores the possibility of native FLIP animations in the browser: oddbird.net/2022/06/29/sha…
Good to know you're over it
content.text: Good to know you're over it

content.html: I'd have called it "Start End Opposite", or SEO, to avoid any confusion 👍
content.text: I'd have called it "Start End Opposite", or SEO, to avoid any confusion 👍

content.html: Hey, you could just call it SEND... Start End Negate Dance
content.text:

Start
End
Negate
Dance

content.html: I find this approach interesting, but would it work if there are other elements like tooltips above the transitioning elements, or if there are other animations, videos or interactions running while the transition takes place? I’m dreaming of an element transition api 😀
content.text:
I find this approach interesting, but would it work if there are other elements like tooltips above the transitioning elements, or if there are other animations, videos or interactions running while the transition takes place?
